> ```C
>     target.sin_family = make_family(ip_port.ip.family);
>     target.sin_port = net_htons(ip_port.port);
>     fill_addr4(ip_port.ip.ip4, &target.sin_addr);
> ```

only IPv4?

*[toxcore/network.h, line 388 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/461#-KbbD-rMmDRMrjVAKLQZ:-KbbD-rMmDRMrjVAKLQ_:b-hjtm5y) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/cb13fb57136eb9b33457d512369bdd292cab21aa/toxcore/network.h#L388)):*
> ```objc
> 
> /* High-level getaddrinfo implementation.
>  * Given node, which identify an Internet host. net_getipport() fill array with
> ```

`which identifies an Internet host.` I don't really understand the rest of the paragraph, can you rephrase/explain it?

>  *
>  * Skip all addresses with socktype != type (use type = -1 to grep all address)
> ```

`to grep all addresses` ?

`To correctly deallocate`?

Review status: 24 of 30 files reviewed at latest revision, 5 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[auto_tests/network_test.c, line 58 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/461#-Kc47x1gl0B9z3dNFwSi:-Kc47x1gl0B9z3dNFwSj:bdftn2f) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/a477e838a5a31c67d250460475a94bb31b57b596/auto_tests/network_test.c#L58)):* > ```C > > if (localhost_split) { > printf("Localhost seems to be split in two.\n"); > ``` This error message doesn't make sense to me, what does `split in two` mean? --- *[toxcore/crypto_core.c, line 217 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/461#-Kc44xGR_h0FxkKvhxfQ:-Kc44xGR_h0FxkKvhxfR:btxph1n) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/a477e838a5a31c67d250460475a94bb31b57b596/toxcore/crypto_core.c#L217)):* > ```C > #if BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN > uint8_t *s = (uint8_t *)&x; > return (uint32_t)(s[0] << 24 | s[1] << 16 | s[2] << 8 | s[3]); > ``` Is there a reason why you used the way with casts instead of the "shift and or" way to change the byte order? Also why does crypto_core need it's own implementation of byte order swapping? If there's a good reason for it, can you add a comment? --- *[toxcore/network.c, line 1236 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/461#-Kc45PNokaAfQBGlAJY0:-Kc45PNqxWYwcECIhN9y:ber1vxl) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/a477e838a5a31c67d250460475a94bb31b57b596/toxcore/network.c#L1236)):* > ```C > *res = (IP_Port*)malloc(sizeof(IP_Port) * count); > if (*res == NULL) { > return -1; > ``` returning `-1` from an `unsigned int` function is wrong --- *[toxcore/network.h, line 388 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/461#-KbbD-rMmDRMrjVAKLQZ:-Kc46y95hG5Vjxsq9p0i:bt5p0r7) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/30a7fbb692bb4bc80b936939d5776b79706226f7/toxcore/network.h#L388)):*

Better but not quite there yet. Which format does `node` have? --- *[toxcore/network.h, line 392 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/461#-Kc47TG3XG5aT981O0cv:-Kc47TG4sP4fbdtdcUxn:b-gct5fc) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/a477e838a5a31c67d250460475a94bb31b57b596/toxcore/network.h#L392)):* > ```objc > * To correctly deallocate array memory use net_freeipport() > * > * return size of res array. > ``` size in bytes or number of entries? --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/461)*

I use cast and "shift and or". Or I don't understand you. > Also why does crypto_core need it's own implementation of byte order swapping? Because `htonl` is implemented in `#include ` we don't want to depend of it --- *[toxcore/network.c, line 1236 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/461#-Kc45PNokaAfQBGlAJY0:-Kc75j8yNKJvF-NV3bcB:b-9zdwtd) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/a477e838a5a31c67d250460475a94bb31b57b596/toxcore/network.c#L1236)):*

returning `-1` from an `unsigned int` function is wrong
-1 is invalid value and indicate invalid function result. It still can be checked with`res != -1` I don't want to lose half of integer just because we need indicator for invalid result --- *[toxcore/network.h, line 388 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/461#-KbbD-rMmDRMrjVAKLQZ:-Kc76CWIMJLf74RTtQ4I:b-do3zdc) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/30a7fbb692bb4bc80b936939d5776b79706226f7/toxcore/network.h#L388)):*

Better but not quite there yet. Which format does `node` have?
It's part of `getaddrinfo` [docs](https://linux.die.net/man/3/getaddrinfo). So it will be retranslated to `getaddrinfo` with their node meaning --- *[toxcore/network.h, line 392 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/461#-Kc47TG3XG5aT981O0cv:-Kc76ktoblaMwQCUFMBN:b-lsbneg) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/a477e838a5a31c67d250460475a94bb31b57b596/toxcore/network.h#L392)):*

AFAIK 'size of array' is alwais mean number of elements (exclude `sizeof` in C) --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/461)*

Reviewed 3 of 7 files at r4. Review status: 27 of 30 files reviewed at latest revision, 4 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[toxcore/crypto_core.c, line 217 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/461#-Kc44xGR_h0FxkKvhxfQ:-Kc8ZPTCnUTCBiVWzuE9:b-5qkg6a) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/a477e838a5a31c67d250460475a94bb31b57b596/toxcore/crypto_core.c#L217)):*
Previously, Diadlo (Polshakov Dmitry) wrote…
> Is there a reason why you used the way with casts instead of the "shift and or" way to change the byte order? I use cast and "shift and or". Or I don't understand you. > Also why does crypto_core need it's own implementation of byte order swapping? Because `htonl` is implemented in `#include ` we don't want to depend of it
I would have done it like this ```swapped = ((num>>24)&0x000000FF) | // move byte 3 to byte 0 ((num<<8)&0x00FF0000) | // move byte 1 to byte 2 ((num>>8)&0x0000FF00) | // move byte 2 to byte 1 ((num<<24)&0xFF000000); // byte 0 to byte 3 ``` this way there's no need to cast anything, which is better I think ``` --- *[toxcore/network.c, line 1236 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/461#-Kc45PNokaAfQBGlAJY0:-Kc8_XXpK3KeuMZ7lGQ8:b-7216av) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/a477e838a5a31c67d250460475a94bb31b57b596/toxcore/network.c#L1236)):*
Previously, Diadlo (Polshakov Dmitry) wrote…
-1 is invalid value and indicate invalid function result. It still can be checked with`res != -1` I don't want to lose half of integer just because we need indicator for invalid result
Then you'd need to make the invalid value `UINT_MAX` or use `0` as error value, or use an error paramenter. I think the way you're doing it currently is not a good practice or defined in the C standard, but prove me wrong :) --- *[toxcore/network.h, line 392 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/461#-Kc47TG3XG5aT981O0cv:-Kc8bhLW7K95CSYbbGIL:b-nvl9hh) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/a477e838a5a31c67d250460475a94bb31b57b596/toxcore/network.h#L392)):*
Previously, Diadlo (Polshakov Dmitry) wrote…
AFAIK 'size of array' is alwais mean number of elements (exclude `sizeof` in C)
I'd prefer `number of elements in res array` to avoid any ambiguity, but I'll leave it up to you. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/461)*

I would have done it like this ```swapped = ((num>>24)&0x000000FF) | // move byte 3 to byte 0 ((num<<8)&0x00FF0000) | // move byte 1 to byte 2 ((num>>8)&0x0000FF00) | // move byte 2 to byte 1 ((num<<24)&0xFF000000); // byte 0 to byte 3 ``` this way there's no need to cast anything, which is better I think

commit.message:
Add part of platform-independent network API implementation

socket      -> net_socket
htons       -> net_htons
htonl       -> net_htonl
connect     -> net_connect
sendto      -> net_sendto_ip4
getaddrinfo -> net_getipport
sa_family_t -> Family

verification.payload:
tree 4c6fff0a086988ab21636e88dbf65c2e40a76a67
parent b2d04eae9d9b76523b877a9e5efd5989f83b143d
author Diadlo <polsha3@gmail.com> 1483777733 +0300
committer Diadlo <polsha3@gmail.com> 1488140176 +0300

Add part of platform-independent network API implementation

socket      -> net_socket
htons       -> net_htons
htonl       -> net_htonl
connect     -> net_connect
sendto      -> net_sendto_ip4
getaddrinfo -> net_getipport
sa_family_t -> Family

tree ab330839c547bd2b74591a2f7b62962c7b23f155
parent b19a9e54643eceaa52e71c0f38fa2ecae5a6809e
author Diadlo <polsha3@gmail.com> 1485718582 +0300
committer Diadlo <polsha3@gmail.com> 1488140364 +0300

Remove network dependency from toxcrypto

labels.description: New feature for the user, not a new feature for build script
labels.name: enhancement

labels.description: Refactoring production code, eg. renaming a variable, not affecting semantics
